intro: Morettia nakkebiana, commonly known as the Nakkebiana orchid, is a species native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its slender, erect stem and dense clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically blooms during the spring and early summer, producing white to pale pink blossoms with intricate patterns. It prefers cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
